<item>
            <title>[LANG-9] [lang] lang.builder classes javadoc edits (mostly typo fixes)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-9</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description></description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340861">LANG-9</key>
            <summary>[lang] lang.builder classes javadoc edits (mostly typo fixes)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pgieser@tampabay.rr.com">Pete Gieser</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 21 Jul 2003 11:16:57 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 16 Oct 2013 08:55:05 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 16 May 2006 12:37:14 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-8] No usage of org.apache.commons.lang.exception.NestableException is untrue!</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-8</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;My program manages to generate this exception&lt;br/&gt;
javac PsiStatus.java&lt;br/&gt;
PsiStatus.java:59: cannot access org.apache.commons.lang.exception.&lt;br/&gt;
NestableException&lt;br/&gt;
file org/apache/commons/lang/exception/NestableException.class not found&lt;br/&gt;
        Connection con = Torque.getConnection(&quot;mypsi&quot;);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;here&apos;s a snippet of source:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;package org.apache.jetspeed.portal.portlets;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;import org.apache.jetspeed.portal.portlets.AbstractInstancePortlet;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.turbine.util.RunData;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.turbine.om.security.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.ecs.ConcreteElement;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.ecs.StringElement;&lt;br/&gt;
import org.apache.torque.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import javax.servlet.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.sql.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import javax.sql.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.text.*;&lt;br/&gt;
import java.util.*;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public class MyClass extends AbstractInstancePortlet&lt;br/&gt;
{&lt;br/&gt;
    public ConcreteElement getContent (RunData runData)&lt;/p&gt;
    {
        Connection con = Torque.getConnection(&quot;mypsi&quot;);
    }
&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Linux&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341099">LANG-8</key>
            <summary>No usage of org.apache.commons.lang.exception.NestableException is untrue!</summary>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-7] [lang] Documentation error in StringUtils.replace</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-7</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following example from the javadoc is incorrect.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;&quot;)    = &quot;aba&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;it should be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;&quot;)    = &quot;b&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341051">LANG-7</key>
            <summary>[lang] Documentation error in StringUtils.replace</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="russelldittmar@charter.net">Russell Dittmar</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 23 Oct 2003 20:19:59 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 16 Dec 2009 08:50:36 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 16 Dec 2009 08:50:36 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.1</fixVersion>
                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12405323" author="scolebourne@joda.org" created="Fri, 24 Oct 2003 03:46:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Well spotted, thanks. Change made.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405324" author="nospam_apacheorg@scovetta.com" created="Thu, 17 Mar 2005 06:05:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As per the online javadocs:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/lang/api/org/apache/commons/lang/StringUtils.html#replace(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/lang/api/org/apache/commons/lang/StringUtils.html#replace(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This seems to have not been fixed:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; StringUtils.replace(null, *, *)        = null&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;&quot;, *, *)          = &quot;&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, null, null) = &quot;aba&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, null, null) = &quot;aba&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, null)  = &quot;aba&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;&quot;)    = &quot;aba&quot; &amp;lt;-- here&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.replace(&quot;aba&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;z&quot;)   = &quot;zbz&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405325" author="fredrik.westermarck@mdh.se" created="Sun, 10 Apr 2005 23:56:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Changing this to &apos;fixed&apos; since this issue has been addressed in the source&lt;br/&gt;
repository.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The javadoc available at &lt;a href=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/lang/api/index.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/lang/api/index.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
reflects the latest released version (2.0) of commons-lang. In that version the&lt;br/&gt;
issue were present. The online javadoc will however be updated when the next&lt;br/&gt;
version of commons-lang is released.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12405326" author="bayard" created="Wed, 26 Apr 2006 13:10:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;2.1 released, closing.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-6] [lang] EqualsBuilder.append(Object[], Object[]) incorrectly checks that rhs[i] is instance of lhs[i]&apos;s class</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-6</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Append two arrays of any object type to an EqualsBuilder using EqualsBuilder.append(Object[], &lt;br/&gt;
Object[]) &amp;#8211; we&apos;ll call the first &apos;lhs&apos; and the second &apos;rhs&apos;. If, for any i, lhs&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; is not null, rhs&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; is not null, &lt;br/&gt;
and rhs&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; is not of the same type as, or a subtype of, lhs&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;i&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, then the EqualsBuilder will return false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However, this behavior is incorrect. While rare, it is perfectly valid in Java to define an equals() method &lt;br/&gt;
on a class A that will return true when passed in an object of some class B, where B is not the same as A &lt;br/&gt;
nor a subtype of A. (A conceptual example is comparing a RGBColor to a CMYKColor, where RGBColor is &lt;br/&gt;
not a subclass of CMYKColor, nor vice-versa. In this example, the EqualsBuilder will return false, &lt;br/&gt;
whether the equals() method is defined on RGBColor to explicitly check CMYKColors, or even if you &lt;br/&gt;
define a base-class Color.equals() method that does an abstract comparison.)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To reproduce:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public static class A {&lt;br/&gt;
  private int a;&lt;br/&gt;
  public A(int a) &lt;/p&gt;
{ this.a = a; }
&lt;p&gt;  public boolean equals(Object o) &lt;/p&gt;
{
    if (o == this) return true;
    if (o instanceof A) return this.a = ((A) o).getA();
    if (o instanceof B) return this.a = ((B) o).getB();
    return false;
  }
&lt;p&gt;  public int getA() &lt;/p&gt;
{ return this.a; }
&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;public static class B {&lt;br/&gt;
  private int b;&lt;br/&gt;
  public B(int b) &lt;/p&gt;
{ this.b = b; }
&lt;p&gt;  public boolean equals(Object o) &lt;/p&gt;
{
    if (o == this) return true;
    if (o instanceof A) return this.b = ((A) o).getA();
    if (o instanceof B) return this.b = ((B) o).getB();
    return false;
  }
&lt;p&gt;  public int getB() &lt;/p&gt;
{ return this.b; }
&lt;p&gt;}&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Object[] x = new Object[] &lt;/p&gt;
{ new A(1) }
&lt;p&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
Object[] y = new Object[] &lt;/p&gt;
{ new B(1) }
&lt;p&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;System.err.println(&quot;x&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(y&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;)? &quot; + x&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(y&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;));&lt;br/&gt;
System.err.println(&quot;Does EqualsBuilder think the arrays are equal? &quot; + (new EqualsBuilder().append(x, &lt;br/&gt;
y).isEquals()));&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This program will output:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;true&lt;br/&gt;
false&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The attached patch adds to an existing unit-test case some code that proves the existence of this bug, &lt;br/&gt;
and also fixes it. (It also fixes &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-42&quot; title=&quot;[lang] EqualsBuilder.append(Object[], Object[]) crashes with a NullPointerException if an element of the first array is null&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;LANG-42&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;COM-1842&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12341995">LANG-6</key>
            <summary>[lang] EqualsBuilder.append(Object[], Object[]) incorrectly checks that rhs[i] is instance of lhs[i]&apos;s class</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="andrew@terracottatech.com">Andrew Geweke</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-5] StringUtils.split ignores empty items</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-5</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;StringUtils.split ignores empty items (eg. delimiter at the beginning of the &lt;br/&gt;
string, 2 delimiters directly after another)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Eg.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;String[] l = StringUtils.split(&quot;X,DE,Germany&quot;, &quot;,&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
results in &lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;X&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;DE&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;Germany&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;String[] l = StringUtils.split(&quot;,DE,Germany&quot;, &quot;,&quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
results in&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;DE&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;Germany&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
expected : &lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;0&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;&quot; (or null ?)&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;DE&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
l&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;2&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; = &quot;Germany&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The current behaviour makes it impossible to detect the &quot;column&quot; (eg. for &lt;br/&gt;
parsing .csv files).&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340929">LANG-5</key>
            <summary>StringUtils.split ignores empty items</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

                                    <reporter username="ludwig@riege.com">Guido Ludwig</reporter>

                                    <component>lang.*</component>
                        <due></due>

                            <comment id="12404928" author="scolebourne@joda.org" created="Fri, 29 Aug 2003 14:41:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;We could do with writing a new StringTokeniser replacement class in &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;lang&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; for &lt;br/&gt;
this. Does anyone know of one to use as a starting point?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404929" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 12 Nov 2003 21:20:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9068)&lt;br/&gt;
Source file for the DelimitedTokenizer class&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404930" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 12 Nov 2003 21:21:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9069)&lt;br/&gt;
TestCase for the DelimitedTokenizer class&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404931" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 12 Nov 2003 21:22:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have created a new class called DelimitedTokenizer which tokenizes strings &lt;br/&gt;
according to a delimited format, such as CSV.  There are certain properties &lt;br/&gt;
which are configurable, including the delimiter character, the quote character, &lt;br/&gt;
ignoring leading whitespace, ignoring trailing whitesapce, and treating zero &lt;br/&gt;
length strings as nulls.  Also enclosed is a small testcase for this class.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404932" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Wed, 12 Nov 2003 22:56:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9070)&lt;br/&gt;

                            <comment id="12404941" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Tue, 25 Nov 2003 07:44:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I can&apos;t find the cvs version.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404942" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Tue, 25 Nov 2003 08:13:49 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9273)&lt;br/&gt;
PatchFile for Tokenizer.java to add reset methods&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404943" author="mattinger@yahoo.com" created="Tue, 25 Nov 2003 08:14:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=9274)&lt;br/&gt;
Patch file for TokenizerTest.java to fix expected output&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404944" author="weberjn" created="Mon, 10 May 2004 19:18:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&quot;Adjacent separators are treated as one separator.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I think this should not be so. Rather it should behave as 1.4 String.split().&lt;br/&gt;
Merging the separators makes having optional parts between delimeters difficult,&lt;br/&gt;
e.g. in corbaloc:iiop:my.host.net:4812/MyName the iiop is optional and can be&lt;br/&gt;
written as corbaloc::my.host.net:4812/MyName. This is easy to parse with&lt;br/&gt;
String.split() but not with StringUtils.split().&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404945" author="stevencaswell@apache.org" created="Sun, 11 Jul 2004 23:52:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created new methods splitPreserveAllTokens to mirror the existing split methods,&lt;br/&gt;
adding the functionality of preserving empty tokens indicated by adjacent separators&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404946" author="bayard" created="Wed, 26 Apr 2006 13:10:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;2.1 released, closing.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-4] Hierarchy support in ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-4</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I just discovered that the method ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString() does not &lt;br/&gt;
work in a class hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For example:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;class A defines inst var a.&lt;br/&gt;
class B extends A defines inst var b.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;new A().toString returns &quot;a=...&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
new B().toString returns &quot;b=...&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;when I expected new B().toString to return &quot;a=...,b=...&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Can I use reflectionToString() to accomplish this?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you for considering this request.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Gary&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340456">LANG-4</key>
            <summary>Hierarchy support in ToStringBuilder.reflectionToString()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ggregory">Gary D. Gregory</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 11 Dec 2002 08:42:44 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 10 Mar 2011 22:30:44 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 16 May 2006 12:44:45 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>2.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>2.0</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>

                            <comment id="12403343" author="ggregory@seagullsw.com" created="Fri, 13 Dec 2002 12:23:26 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=4155)&lt;br/&gt;

if you have a chance &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403345" author="ggregory@seagullsw.com" created="Wed, 15 Jan 2003 02:46:40 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have looked at the mods to my patch and find that all is well with the &lt;br/&gt;
exception of the mismatch between the code and the in-line comment:&lt;/p&gt;

or the throw re-inserted.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

().&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[LANG-3] [lang] PADDING array in StringUtils overflows on &apos;\uffff&apos;</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-3</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The PADDING array in class StringUtils is one entry too short.&lt;br/&gt;
As declared, it overflows on &apos;\uffff&apos;.&lt;br/&gt;
To test, run:&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.leftPad(&quot;abcd&quot;, 10, &apos;\ufffe&apos;) // no exception&lt;br/&gt;
 StringUtils.leftPad(&quot;abcd&quot;, 10, &apos;\uffff&apos;) // ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Current code:&lt;br/&gt;
    private static final String[] PADDING = new String&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Character.MAX_VALUE&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;br/&gt;
Suggested fix: &lt;br/&gt;
    private static final String[] PADDING = new String&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Character.MAX_VALUE + 1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: Windows XP&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: PC&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12342376">LANG-3</key>

            <title>[LANG-2] [lang] javadoc example for StringUtils.splitByWholeSeparator incorrect</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LANG-2</link>
                <project id="12310481" key="LANG">Commons Lang</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the javadoc examples for the StringUtils.splitByWholeSeparator(...) methods &lt;br/&gt;
are not correct.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;ul class=&quot;alternate&quot; type=&quot;square&quot;&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The examples of splitByWholeSeperator(String,String) are illustrating the&lt;br/&gt;
usage of the StringUtils.split(String,String) method.&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;The 6th example of splitByWholeSeperator(String,String,int) is not correct&lt;br/&gt;
and should be removed.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;


&lt;p&gt;regards,&lt;br/&gt;
Maarten&lt;/p&gt;</description>

                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12404886" author="pgieser@tampabay.rr.com" created="Sat, 16 Aug 2003 12:29:39 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=7847)&lt;br/&gt;
Javadoc patch for lang&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404887" author="pgieser@tampabay.rr.com" created="Sat, 16 Aug 2003 12:30:20 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Created an attachment (id=7848)&lt;br/&gt;
Fix typos patch&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404888" author="scolebourne@joda.org" created="Sat, 16 Aug 2003 20:12:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have applied all of the testing patch.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For the main patch, I have applied as much as I can. This includes everything &lt;br/&gt;
except the builder package and StringUtils.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, the main patch was really too large, and contained too many &lt;br/&gt;
changes. You have put a lot of work into the builder package, however I found &lt;br/&gt;
some mistakes in the changes, and also a serious problem where a method was &lt;br/&gt;
renamed. This shook my confidence in applying the patch.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I applied changes for CompareToBuilder manually, agreeing with some of your &lt;br/&gt;
changes, disagreeing with others. This took about 2 hours for the one class, so &lt;br/&gt;
I cannot procede to the others at present.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t want to dishearten you, as javadoc patches are very useful. For the &lt;br/&gt;
future however I suggest contacting the mailing list first. I would also &lt;br/&gt;
suggest separating javadoc fixes (eg.missing @param/@return) from javadoc text &lt;br/&gt;
changes (better/different description) from javadoc style (html tags etc.). For &lt;br/&gt;
me, each patch should take less than 30 mins (preferably 15mins) and be about &lt;br/&gt;
one thing and one thing only.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;thanks&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="12404889" author="pgieser@tampabay.rr.com" created="Sat, 16 Aug 2003 21:21:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I understand your perspective and agree that it was too large.  I guess I was&lt;br/&gt;
trying to get it all in before 2.0, but perhaps that was optimistic.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I don&apos;t remember the instance of a changed method name.  But I do remember&lt;br/&gt;
running the lang tests numerous times and never got an failure.  Did I change&lt;br/&gt;
the test too?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As for the other minor errors, did the tests not cover them?&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Anyway, lesson learned. I will be more proactive asking about things on the list&lt;br/&gt;
before making changes.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thanks for looking at it!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12404890" author="scolebourne@joda.org" created="Sat, 16 Aug 2003 21:44:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The changed method name was in ToStringStyle (isShortClassName).&lt;/p&gt;

didn&apos;t describe the classes functionality accurately. Can&apos;t remember where.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
